alert.note: Alert for Bonner; Boundary; Shoshone (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 23 at 9:22PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: .A slow moving low pressure system will support afternoon thunderstorms. The storms will be stationary to slow moving, allowing for heavy rain amounts over small areas causing flash flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall will be possible. * WHERE...Portions of North Idaho, including the following counties, Bonner, Boundary and Shoshone. Portions of Northeast Washington, including the following counties, Ferry, Pend Oreille and Stevens. * WHEN...Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Slow moving thunderstorms will bring heavy downpours across the area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
